timeline.message:
:art: Code cleanup to have only one AddMemberButton

Included refactoring of roles context to be more than just project roles.
:construction: Initial code for project user groups
:construction: work on removing a user group from project.
Basic setup to get available user groups
Cleaned up usage of remove button

timeline.bodyText: Just a general question. Even if there is an error deleting the usergroup would we still want it to return a ResponseEntity.ok? Or should we set the status as a bad request with the error message?
timeline.author: deepsidhu85

replies.bodyText: No but it should throw it's own error at that point and not actually return here.
replies.author: joshsadam

timeline.bodyText: We should probably set this as a bad request instead of an internal server error as this really isn't an internal server error
timeline.author: deepsidhu85

timeline.bodyText: Can you change the - to . here and in the translation keys below? Just to keep with the format we have for the keys
timeline.author: deepsidhu85
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -369,6 +369,25 @@ AddMemberButton.modal.user-help=Search by first name, last name, or username.
 AddMemberButton.modal.role=Project Role
 AddMemberButton.modal.okText=Add Member
 
+# ========================================================================================== #
+# Project User Groups                                                                        #
+# ========================================================================================== #
+server.usergroups.remove-group.success={0} removed from this project.

timeline.bodyText: Clicking the cancel or x button in the modal results in the modal just refreshing and not actually closing
timeline.author: deepsidhu85

timeline.bodyText: A question related to this file. Should it be allowed for a group to be left without an owner? Testing this out on the group members table let's me change the owner to a member (currently only the one member is a part of the group)?
timeline.author: deepsidhu85

replies.bodyText: The method to assess this is completely screwed, trying to fix it now
replies.author: joshsadam

timeline.author: deepsidhu85

 import { render } from "react-dom";

timeline.bodyText: Shouldn't we use setBaseUrl here? Probably best to set it at the top of the function as it used a couple of times
timeline.author: deepsidhu85
timeline.diffHunk: @@ -30,10 +32,10 @@ export function UserGroups() { } > - - - - + +

replies.bodyText: This was already addressed in a different merge and will be addressed by merging in dev

timeline.message: Changed from server error to bad request
Fix for issue where modal was not closing on cancel
Fixed issue where a user group could result in to owner
